title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Monday 27 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: chinese restaurant fire : one person taken to hospital .
chief minister to face questions on jersey lifeboat cover .
cuts to overseas aid 'could damage guernsey 's reputation ' .
afternoon sailing between guernsey and sark to be reviewed .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for today .
we 'll be back on tuesday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey millionaire 'getting back on the bike ' with old business
text: an entrepreneur from guernsey who last year crashed at over 200mph in a high-speed race is looking to buy back the brand he founded .

this time last year zef eisenberg , founder of maximuscle , was lying in hospital following operations to fit a titanium hip , three titanium bolts in his ankles , and plates in his collar bone , shoulder joint and pelvis .
now , after recovering from his injuries , the motorsport enthusiast is not only trying to break his own land speed record , he is looking to buy back the business which made him his fortune .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: rain and wind to clear overnight
text: the rain will gradually clear southwards , and colder conditions with broken cloud and scattered showers will follow .
the wind should also ease
minimum temperature : 7c ( 45f )
tomorrow it will be breezy with sunny intervals and showers for the channel islands , with some of the showers becoming heavy at times .
it will be feeling noticeably cooler compared to today .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f )

documents.title: senator ozouf apologises over expenses
text: a former minister whose expenses claims were referred to the police has apologised and referred his conduct to the new commissioner for standards .
senator philip ozouf made a statement in the states this afternoon , and said law officers decided not to prosecute him over two transactions made using his states card .
senator ozouf said he paid back £ 360 for a personal flight booked by mistake with his states card , and the other was £ 82 for a gatwick hotel when he was meeting an overseas delegation .
he told his colleagues it was up to members to take action and apologise if they breach the code , whether by accident or not .
author: Chris Rayner
BBC Radio Jersey Political Reporter

documents.title: what is gdp ?
text: the release of data on how guernsey 's economy is performing has been delayed , with 2016 gross domestic product ( gdp ) figures now due in december .
but why is the measure so important ?
the states of guernsey periodically releases information on employment , earnings and house prices , but gdp attempts to capture the state of the economy in one number .
if the gdp measure is up on the previous year , the economy is growing .
if it is negative it is contracting .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: scrutiny of jersey post relaxed by regulator
text: jersey post has improved its quality of service , according to the island 's regulator , meaning it will no longer be as heavily scrutinised .
the channel islands competition and regulatory authorities ( cicra ) said it would reduce its oversight of the service based on its latest performance report .
in june , cicra highlighted concerns that jersey post had failed to meet three of its nine quality of service targets in 2016 .
however , improvements were seen in august , and the regulator said the island 's postal service had `` met all the targets '' for the second quarter of 2017 .
today cicra announced jersey post had `` continued to meet all nine quality of service targets '' for the third quarter of the year `` with an above target performance '' .
it added `` we are now able to return to annual monitoring '' .
cicra has relaxed its requirement for jersey post to publish its performance quarterly following demonstrable improvements in its quality of service .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: firearms surrender : 108 items handed in to jersey police
text: more than a hundred items were handed into jersey police as part of a national firearms surrender including the uk and guernsey , codename operation aztec .
officers said they were `` surprised '' by the number of weapons received , including :
ammunition was also given in during the amnesty .
head of firearms , ch insp chris beechey said : we will now engage the help of partners to identify those items of historical value and interest to ensure that they end up in the right place . ''
the surrender initiative was led by the national ballistics intelligence service .
it is the first time jersey has taken part in a national firearms surrender .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: health advice issued in alderney over antibiotic concerns
text: islanders have been advised on the risks of over using antibiotics for minor infection , which increases the chances of producing antibiotic resistant strains of bacteria .
patients have been warned the drugs are often not suitable to treat colds , and should be prescribed `` responsibly '' , pharmacists say .
gps are strongly advised to only prescribe antibiotics when they are truly needed and not for self-limiting mild infections such as winter colds .
if bacteria become resistant to available antibiotics , many routine treatments will again become dangerous .
patients in the at-risk groups should have a flu vaccine as soon as possible .
setting broken bones , basic operations and even chemotherapy all rely on antibiotics that work .
we have had a good reduction in their use recently .
and this is something we must all continue to work together on . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: police appeal to family members aware of domestic abuse
text: jersey police want people to contact them if they think any member of their family is being abused at home .
agencies have launched a new campaign called `` sitting right with you '' to make people aware of what constitutes domestic abuse - both mental and physical .
islanders can sit on a yellow sofa in st helier today which plays recorded examples of abuse , and speak to officers who will be in the area for advice .
jersey police say they attend an average of three domestic abuse incidents every day , equating to about 12 % of recorded crime .
the latest police figures show the number of domestic incidents have decreased by 8 % , but within this high risk domestic incidents have risen by 11 % .
we 're looking for members of the public to support , to call in the police , to call in the agency approach if they see or are aware of a family member who may be the victim of domestic abuse . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: jersey congratulates royal couple on engagement
text: in the states assembly this afternoon the bailiff , sir william bailhache , congratulated prince harry and meghan markle on their engagement on behalf of the people of jersey .
he added he hoped jersey `` may be honoured one day by a visit from you both '' .
the prince , fifth in line to the throne , will marry ms markle in spring 2018 .
the couple , who have been dating since the summer of 2016 , secretly got engaged earlier this month .
the states are hearing questions from members today , ahead of the budget debate tomorrow .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey team announced to play in fa inter-league cup
text: the guernsey fa has announced a representative team of the guernsey priaulx league will travel to play against the essex and suffolk border league in the second round of the fa inter-league cup competition .
the cup is limited to leagues at step seven of the fa 's national league system , which manages teams below the english football league 's league two .
guernsey 's team , managed by steve sharman , has been announced for the fixture .

on saturday 2nd december , the representative team of the guernsey priaulx league , managed by steve sharman , will travel to play against the essex and suffolk border league in the second round of the fa inter-league cup competition .
read more at
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: fire in st clement 'under control '
text: fire crews have dealt with a kitchen fire at a house in st clement .
police said the fire at la rue des nouettes was reported to them at 16:19 gmt and `` under control '' by 16:32 gmt .
there do not appear to be any casualties .
2 fire engines are attending a fire in kitchen and flat roof in a st clement property .
firefighter 's in ba with water jets fighting it .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: sarah groves murder trial : accused to be examined by doctors
text: doctors have been ordered to examine the man accused of murdering sarah groves , from guernsey , to determine if he is fit to stand trail , according to the victim 's father , vic groves .
the judge issued the instruction during the latest hearing in srinagar .
richard de wit was charged with miss groves ' murder in june 2013 and the trial started a month later .
he denies the charges against him .

according to news agency reports an application to classify richard de wit as unfit for trial was refused , with the court directing the principal of srinagar medical college to put together a team of doctors to examine him .
the hearing is due to resume tomorrow .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: travel : cars advised not to use small lanes to avoid works
text: bailiffs cross road in st andrew 's will be closed for the next four weeks , the states have said , warning drivers to allow extra time for journeys .
this morning traffic and highway services said vehicles tried to use the small lanes around les truchots to avoid the works , causing `` severe '' congestion .
`` all drivers are requested to not use these lanes and to use the official diversion routes , '' a spokesman said .
whilst the work is taking place access to properties and les bourgs hos is from the rue piette end of the road .
diversions are in place around talbot valley , past the king mills water treatment works , and up rue du preel .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: alcohol use for 2016 released
text: the states of jersey statistics unit has released a report on recent trends of alcohol use in jersey .
the report 's key findings are :
the report is part of the statistics unit 's push to provide overall health figures for the island .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: street re-opens after restaurant fire
text: police have re-opened a jersey road after a building fire .
gloucester street was closed earlier this afternoon after a fire started in the mandarin room restaurant .
ambulance crews said one person was taken to hospital and treated for smoke inhalation .
both lanes of gloucester street are now open .
the fire has been fully extinguished and there were no casualties .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: restaurant fire out - one person in hospital
text: a fire at a chinese restaurant in gloucester street in st helier is now out , fire crews have said .
one person was taken to hospital suffering from smoke inhailation .
the blaze is thought to have started in the mandarin room kitchen .
fire in gloucester street now out .
crews are carrying out final checks and making up equipment/hoses .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: pilots avoid close shave
text: six of aurigny 's pilots are sporting moustaches for a good cause .

pilots ben george santos ( left ) , ben thompson ( centre ) , dave warren ( right ) , peter dunbar , john mcgill and sam benjamin are all growing their very best moustaches this month to support movember , raising £ 545 so far as part of the challenge .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: inert waste site proposed by states
text: an extension to the current land reclamation at longue hougue has been identified as the best option to solve the issues with inert waste in guernsey , according to the states .
but conservationists say the area , including the northern end of belle greve bay , was chosen as an `` easy option '' which `` nobody would notice '' , and islanders should not lose the bay .
richard evans from the states said the development had already undergone an environmental impact assessment , and added the current plans do not involve the belle greve bay area .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: fifteen firefighters tackling blaze
text: fire in gloucester street has spread from a kitchen to the upper floors through ducting .
3 x & 15 firefighters at scene .
please avoid all roads leading to gloucester street .
we can see you at work from cyril le marquand house wish the conditions were better for you up there .
we tried to open a window to take this but it was too windy !
take care

documents.title: breakingchinese restaurant fire : one person taken to hospital
text: one person has been taken to hospital after a fire in st helier .
the ambulance service said the person was being treated for smoke inhalation .
the fire is thought to have started in the kitchen of the mandarin room restaurant on gloucester street .
kai gallery who lives on the third floor of the same building said he opened the door of his flat to find the corridor filled with smoke '' before he left the building .
fire crews remain at the scene tackling the blaze .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: firefighters 'trying to prevent blaze spreading '
text: a fire at a chinese restaurant in st helier is being tackled by crews .
an aerial ladder platform is being used in a bid to prevent the blaze spreading to the roof , jersey fire and rescue service said .
three fire engines are at the scene of the mandarin restaurant in gloucester street , st helier .
gloucester st fire spread from flue to upper floors .
aerial ladder platform being used to prevent fire spread to roof .
gloucester street closed due to fire in premises , expect delays

documents.title: fire started in chinese restaurant , police say
text: emergency services are at the scene of a fire at a chinese restaurant in jersey .
firefighters were called to gloucester street , st helier , earlier this afternoon .
officers say the fire is thought to have started in the mandarin room kitchen .
smoke can be seen emerging from a vent on the top of the attached building .
fire in extractor flue of mandarin restaurant possible spread to other floors .
firefighter 's in breathing apparatus trying to contain
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: breaking'i 'll lead or leave '
text: a politician vying to replace deputy peter ferbrache says he will either lead the committee for economic development or resign if unsuccessful .
current vice president jan kuttlewascher confirmed to the bbc he is seeking to replace deputy ferbrache , who stepped down last week .
several deputies are reportedly interested in the senior position responsible for fostering economic growth .
`` i do n't see any potential candidates i could serve under , so if i was n't successful i will be resigning from the committee , '' deputy kuttlewascher says .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: jersey fire 'in extractor flue ' could have 'spread to other floors '
text: a fire in an extractor flue is being tackled by firefighters in jersey .
three fire engines are at the scene of the mandarin restaurant in gloucester street , st helier .
jersey fire and rescue service said it was `` possible '' the blaze had `` spread to other floors '' and firefighters in breathing apparatus were trying to contain it .
aerial ladder platform now being sent to fire in gloucester st
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: third fire engine sent to gloucester street fire
text: a 3rd fire engine has been requested by crews at the fire in gloucester st. traffic is very heavy , avoid area .

documents.title: breakingfire reported in gloucester street
text: fire reported at a property in gloucester street , please avoid area .

documents.title: economic data could be three months ' late
text: the most comprehensive measure of how guernsey 's economy is performing might not be released until december , a states spokesman says .
the island 's 2016 gross domestic product ( gdp ) figures were due in september , but are now expected some time before mid-december .
gdp has only grown by 0.47 % in total from 2013 to 2015 .
the delay is being put down to a new method of calculating the measure of national income , which is being updated and validated by an external auditor .
`` once the validation has been completed , the new figures will be published , including a restatement of the currently published values , '' the states says .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: reds unhappy after yorkshire defeat
text: jersey reds coach neil tunnah says his side were second best as they lost 20-10 at home to yorkshire carnegie .
jersey led 7-5 at half-time thanks to josh hodson 's try , but two second-half tries from former jersey prop marc thomas and louis brown sealed the win .
`` it was a disappointing and frustrating afternoon , '' tunnah told bbc radio jersey after the defeat .
`` we had a fair number of individual errors and we did n't control the field in the way we needed to . ''
jersey stay 10th in the championship , but 11th-placed london scottish have now drawn level with the islanders .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: rnli lifeboat withdrawal a loss to 'vital part ' of service
text: the chief officer of the channel islands air search ( cias ) has said the islands have lost a `` vital part '' of their search and rescue capacity with the departure of the st helier lifeboat .
the lifeboat was withdrawn by the rnli and taken to the uk earlier in november following a dispute between the charity and the crew , who were later stood down .
however , john fitzgerald said the guernsey lifeboat will always be ready to help in any emergency .
you 've lost a vital part of the search and rescue framework in the channel islands .
but you 're not too far from guernsey and our lifeboat can down in an hour or so , or ahead of time looking for what you 're searching for . ''
cias volunteers have given a tour of their facilities to the lieutenant governors of both jersey and guernsey today , and have a new plane under construction after the lion 's pride crashed in 2013 .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: powerboat association splits from regulating body
text: the guernsey powerboat association has pulled out of a uk governing body after saying it has become `` too political '' .
the royal yachting association oversees powerboat racing in the uk .
the guernsey association claims increased regulation has made it more difficult for people to compete and led to the split .
chairman mark sauverin said the group now want to focus on making it easier to get more people involved in the sport before holding races in the future .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: lieutenant governors tour air search facilities
text: the lieutenant governors of jersey and guernsey have visited the channel islands air search hangar at guernsey airport .
air chief marshal sir stephen dalton will join vice admiral ian corder for a tour .
they will meet some of the crew members and fundraisers who have helped raise £ 800,000 for a new aircraft to replace lion 's pride , which crashed in november 2013 .
john fitzgerald , the charity 's chief officer , said he hoped the plane , which is currently under construction , would be in service early next year .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: raiders seal win with final play
text: guernsey raiders scored a try with the final play of the match to seal a 22-16 win at barnes in london and south east premier .

the two sides were neck-and-neck for most of the game with barnes kicking a penalty with five minutes left to put them ahead before the islanders encamped on the home side 's try-line and eventually forced their way over .
the win pushes the green and whites up to second in the division , three points off leaders hertford .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: ferbrache exit could have been dealt with 'more tactfully '
text: the chairman of the confederation of guernsey industry has said he was sad to see peter ferbrache leave a prominent government position over an issue that could have been dealt with `` more tactfully '' .
clive minns added he hoped the resignation of the president of the committee for economic development would not result in a `` loss of momentum '' .
deputy peter ferbrache stood down last week over a perceived conflict of interest .
but , he denies doing anything wrong .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: campaign against domestic abuse to launch
text: a nationwide campaign to encourage people to report domestic abuse will be launched in the centre of st helier today .
the `` sitting right with you '' campaign aims to make people recognise the signs of domestic abuse .
the campaign 's hashtag is being widely shared among local authorities and police forces across the uk .
jersey police said officers dealt with nearly 1,000 cases of domestic violence last year , and have been promoting the campaign .
a yellow sofa with recorded messages will be in king 's street this week .
deputy kristina moore , jersey 's minister for home affairs , urged victims to come forward and said help is available for those being abused in a relationship .
it 's time to end the stigma that surrounds domestic abuse - it 's time to start the conversation .
# sittingrightwithyou
time to end fly tipping as well .
probably should find somewhere more appropriate to dump your old sofa too .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: trench life : 'i would not have coped '
text: students in guernsey have been taking part in commemorations marking a difficult period in the island 's history .
pupils from a number of schools have dug a replica world war one trench , as the island marks the battle of cambrai , where many guernsey men died a century ago .
forty per cent of the royal guernsey light infantry were killed , captured or wounded during the battle .
cambrai was heralded as the longed-for victory on the western front .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: st ouen keep gap at top of premiership
text: st ouen kept their four-point lead at the top of jersey 's premiership after a 3-2 win over jersey wanderers .
tommy hall , anthony norman , dom pougeolle were on target for the parish side .
they have played two games more than second-placed st clement who were 3-1 winners over st peter thanks in part to a brace of goals from matt rawlings .
reigning champions st paul 's are still third with a perfect record of nine points from three games after their match with rozel rovers was postponed .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: successful trials likely to lead to increase in hemp production
text: there is likely to be a `` large increase '' in the production of hemp in jersey next year following successful trials this summer , the environment minister has said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: 'woeful ' first half costs guernsey fc
text: guernsey fc boss tony vance criticised his team 's first-half performance in their 3-1 loss at hastings town .
trailing 2-0 at half-time , frank tobin pulled one back after the break before a late third for the hosts .
`` we were woeful in the first half .
we just were n't at the races and they completely dominated us , '' vance said .
`` in the second half they were much better , they took the game to them and as dominant as hastings were in the first half , we were in the second . ''
the loss saw guernsey slip to 19th place in isthmian league division one south .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: chamber of commerce opposes 20 % retail tax
text: jersey business leaders will not support a 20 % retail tax proposed in the islands 2018 budget , according to the chamber of commerce .
a spokesman said the island 's businesses have faced a raft of additional tax burdens this year and the 20 % rate threatened future investment in training , premises and services .
adding , if states members vote in favour of a tax , it could agree on a 10 % rate .
the island 's retail association has agreed , and is concerned the tax would be imposed on smaller businesses in future .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: delaying education debate will add 'risk and uncertainty '
text: delaying the debate into the future of secondary and post-16 education by a month will add another £ 3m to £ 4m to education 's reform plans , the committee 's president has warned .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: telegraph owners accused of 'washing hands ' of building
text: the billionaire owners of the telegraph have been accused of `` washing their hands '' of one of the uk 's most important and unusual industrial buildings after leaving it to rot for more than a decade and then putting it up for auction for £ 1 .
temple works is a grade i-listed former flax mill in leeds which boasts a 0.8 hectare ( 2 acre ) factory floor which was once the largest room in the world .

the building , once described by the yorkshire post as looking like a stately home for a pharaoh '' , has been owned since 2004 by the secretive barclay family , who bought the telegraph media group in 2004 .
the barclays did not respond for comment via the telegraph press office .
author: The Guardian

documents.title: rain and wind to arrive soon
text: outbreaks of rain will soon arrive , these becoming heavy at times , especially this afternoon .
it will be windy today , with gales likely .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 53f )
jersey :
guernsey :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: woman 'filmed in shower through window '
text: a woman has been filmed in the shower by someone using a mobile phone put through an open window , guernsey police have said in an appeal to trace the offender .
it happened on saturday in les tracheries , st sampson , at about 18:15 .
officers are appealing for witnesses .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: team jets are beaten again
text: jersey 's team jets are still second-from-bottom of premier league three after an agonising 46-45 loss at team norfolk .
the islanders collected two bonus points in norwich , but are still in the relegation zone .
jersey have won just one of their six games so far this season .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: cuts to overseas aid 'could damage guernsey 's reputation '
text: the head of guernsey 's overseas aid commission has said any move to cut the aid budget will make the island look like a `` mean tax haven '' .
deputy emilie yerby said the states can not risk damaging the island 's reputation at `` such a critical time '' .
this week the states will debate changes in current legislation which would make contributions towards overseas aid , voluntary .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: afternoon sailing between guernsey and sark to be reviewed
text: sark shipping company has said monday afternoon 's sailing will be reviewed .
the morning sailings are unaffected , but travellers are advised later sailing times could be changed after 14:00 .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: chief minister to face questions on lifeboat cover
text: pressure will be put on jersey 's chief minister to intervene in the recent lifeboat dispute at today 's states sitting .

two members will ask what senator ian gorst has done to make sure an all-weather lifeboat is brought back into service at st helier , and what he is doing to make sure islanders are safe when they go to sea .
the lifeboat was withdrawn by the rnli and taken to the uk earlier in november following a dispute between the charity and the crew .
on the same day the charity also closed the st helier lifeboat station due to the `` relationship breakdown '' with the crew .
members are sitting a day early today for question time , ahead of the budget debate tomorrow .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: local live across the channel islands
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live for the channel islands .
stay with us for all the latest news , weather , travel , and sport .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online
